info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 01 at 12:19AM EST until January 01 at 12:45AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOORE AND NORTHWESTERN HOKE COUNTIES... At 1218 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Aberdeen, or near Southern Pines, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Whispering Pines, Pinebluff, Foxfire, Taylortown and Ashley Heights. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a tornado warning may need to be issued.
